revised_title: Eurypterid Respiration: A Study of Evolution and Environment in the Late Silurian and Early Devonian
tldr: This study investigates the respiration of eurypterids, ancient marine arthropods, and compares their gill tract with known arthropod respiratory organs. The eurypterid gill tract is discussed in relation to its possible functions, including aquatic respiration and possible air-breathing adaptations. The findings suggest that eurypterids were primarily aquatic animals, and their respiratory organs likely evolved secondarily.
